decisions.cost_analysis: Reroute cost: ₹525 (35×₹15). Revenue saved: ₹2,821.19 (35×₹80.62 avg margin). Net: +₹2,296.19
decisions.reasoning: CFO perspective: Calculates ₹2,821.19 revenue potential - ₹525 cost = ₹2,296.19 net benefit. CTO perspective: 92.1% failure rate affecting VIP customers for 2 hours violates our 99.5% SLA commitment. Pattern stability indicates systemic HDFC issue, making reroute to Razorpay likely to succeed. Moderator synthesis: Unanimous decision—both financial profitability and operational reliability perspectives strongly align.

decisions.cost_analysis: Reroute cost: ₹240 (16×₹15). Revenue saved: ₹442.56 (16×₹27.66 avg margin). Net: +₹202.56
decisions.reasoning: CFO perspective: Calculates ₹442.56 revenue potential - ₹240 cost = ₹202.56 net benefit. CTO perspective: 26.2% failure rate is relatively low but still worth rerouting for customer experience. Moderator synthesis: Both perspectives agree on rerouting for customer satisfaction and moderate profit.

decisions.cost_analysis: Reroute cost: ₹600 (40×₹15). Revenue saved: ₹221.05 (40×₹5.51 avg margin). Net: -₹378.95
decisions.reasoning: CFO perspective: Calculates -₹378.95 net loss. CTO perspective: 39.2% failure rate is moderate but the low average transaction amount makes rerouting less viable. Moderator synthesis: Both perspectives agree on ignoring due to low profit margin and moderate failure rate.
